info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-flex-cfg
info.description:
Model for managing flex configurations
     Copyright (c) 2016-2020, 2022-2023 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

**Configuration Module**
**Module:** `Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-flex-cfg`
**Paths:** 8

put.description: Create or replace Yang model for configuring site

patch.description: Partially modify Yang model for configuring site

delete.description: Delete Yang model for configuring site

put.description: Create or replace Flex policy profile configuration

patch.description: Partially modify Flex policy profile configuration

get.description: Flex profile name mapped to the site tag (collection)

post.description: Add a new entry to Flex profile name mapped to the site tag (collection)

get.description: Flex profile name mapped to the site tag

put.description: Create or replace Flex profile name mapped to the site tag

patch.description: Partially modify Flex profile name mapped to the site tag

delete.description: Delete Flex profile name mapped to the site tag

get.description: Flex profile name mapped to the site tag (collection)

post.description: Add a new entry to Flex profile name mapped to the site tag (collection)

get.description: Flex profile name mapped to the site tag

put.description: Create or replace Flex profile name mapped to the site tag

patch.description: Partially modify Flex profile name mapped to the site tag

delete.description: Delete Flex profile name mapped to the site tag

get.description: Flex profile name mapped to the site tag (collection)

post.description: Add a new entry to Flex profile name mapped to the site tag (collection)

get.description: Flex profile name mapped to the site tag

put.description: Create or replace Flex profile name mapped to the site tag

patch.description: Partially modify Flex profile name mapped to the site tag

is-peap.description: Enable or Disable Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol(PEAP)

is-leap.description: Enable or Disable Lightweight Extensible Authentication Protocol(LEAP)

is-eap.description: Enable or Disable Extensible Authentication Protocol(EAP)

is-tls.description: Enable or Disable Transport Layer Security(TLS)

vlan-id.description: VLAN ID to be mapped to the ACL for the Access Point identified by VLAN name.

ingress-acl-name.description: Name of the ingress Access Control List for the vlan-acl mapping

egress-acl-name.description: Name of the egress Access Control List for the vlan-acl mapping

acl-name.description: Name of bidirectional Access Control List (ACL) for the VLAN-ACL mapping

is-cwa.description: Enable or Disable central webauth for this ACL.

urlfilterlist-name.description: Mapping of IPv4/IPv6 ACL name to url filter list this ACL.

user-name.description: User name for this group, used for authenticating a client associated to an AP within the group

password.description:
Password for the given username, to be used for authenticating a client associated to an AP within the group. Following criteria should be met if wireless password policy is configured.
         - Default passwords (cisco, Cisco, C!sco, ci$co, ..) are not allowed.
         - Reverse default passwords are not allowed.
         - At least one lower case letter is mandatory.
         - At least one upper case letter is mandatory.
         - At least one digit is mandatory.
         - Special characters are allowed, but not mandatory.
         - More than two sequential chars or digits (e.g., abc, 123) are not allowed.
         - More than two repeated chars or digits (e.g., 111, aaa) are not allowed.
         - Minimum password length is 8.
         Restriction: Flex local auth password of cleartext type must contain ASCII characters only. This rule is not implemented using constraints.

password-type.description: Password encryption type for authentication by AP

interface-name.description: VLAN name for the vlan-acl mapping.

acl-name-in.description: Name of ingress Access Control List (ACL) for the VLAN-ACL mapping

acl-name-out.description: Name of egress Access Control List(ACL) for the VLAN-ACL mapping

flex-overlap-ip-enable.description: Enable IP overlap support for site

eap-fast-profile-name.description: EAP fast profile used for local auth

radius-server-group-name.description: Radius server group name for authentication

fallback-radio-shut.description: Whether Fallback Radio Shut feature is enabled for the flexconnect Access Points connected to the Wireless LAN Controller

arp-caching.description: Whether ARP cache feature is enabled for the flexconnect Access Points connected to the Wireless LAN Controller

cts-inline-tagging.description: Whether CTS inline tagging feature is enabled for the flexconnect Access Points connected to the Wireless LAN Controller

cts-rolebased-enforce.description: Whether CTS rolebased enforcement feature is enabled for flexconnect Access Points connected to the Wireless LAN Controller

join-min-latency.description: REAP AP should join controller with smallest latency

vlan-enable.description: Availability of Native VLAN configured on this REAP

is-home-ap-enable.description: APs connected to this profile/group are used as Home APs

is-radio-backhaul.description: Enable or Disable WLAN on backhaul radio

is-resilient-mode.description: Enable or Disable Standalone mode support on a REAP AP.

efficient-ap-upgrade-enable.description: Efficient AP image upgrade is enabled

native-vlan-id.description: Native VLAN ID for the particular AP

slave-max-retry-count.description: Maximum retries the slave has to undertake to start the download from the master in the HREAP group

acct-radius-server-group-name.description: Radius server group name for accounting

is-local-roaming-enable.description: Enable or Disable distributed client data caching on AP for local roaming.

dhcp-bcast.description: DHCP broadcast for locally switched clients

is-peap.description: Enable or Disable Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol(PEAP)

is-leap.description: Enable or Disable Lightweight Extensible Authentication Protocol(LEAP)

is-eap.description: Enable or Disable Extensible Authentication Protocol(EAP)

is-tls.description: Enable or Disable Transport Layer Security(TLS)

vlan-id.description: VLAN ID to be mapped to the ACL for the REAP group

ingress-acl-name.description: Name of the ingress Access Control List for the vlan-acl mapping

egress-acl-name.description: Name of the egress Access Control List for the vlan-acl mapping

acl-name.description: Name of the webpolicy Access Control List(ACL) to be mapped to the REAP group

is-cwa.description: Enable or Disable central webauth for this ACL.

urlfilterlist-name.description: Mapping of IPv4/IPv6 ACL name to url filter list this ACL.

user-name.description: User name for this group, used for authenticating a client associated to an AP within the group

password.description:
Password for the given username, to be used for authenticating a client associated to an AP within the group. Following criteria should be met if wireless password policy is configured.
         - Default passwords (cisco, Cisco, C!sco, ci$co, ..) are not allowed.
         - Reverse default passwords are not allowed.
         - At least one lower case letter is mandatory.
         - At least one upper case letter is mandatory.
         - At least one digit is mandatory.
         - Special characters are allowed, but not mandatory.
         - More than two sequential chars or digits (e.g., abc, 123) are not allowed.
         - More than two repeated chars or digits (e.g., 111, aaa) are not allowed.
         - Minimum password length is 8.
         Restriction: Flex local auth password of cleartext type must contain ASCII characters only. This rule is not implemented using constraints.

password-type.description: Password encryption type for authentication by AP

is-leap.description: Enable or Disable Lightweight Extensible Authentication Protocol(LEAP)

is-eap.description: Enable or Disable Extensible Authentication Protocol(EAP)

is-tls.description: Enable or Disable Transport Layer Security(TLS)

vlan-id.description: VLAN ID to be mapped to the ACL for the REAP group

ingress-acl-name.description: Name of the ingress Access Control List for the vlan-acl mapping

egress-acl-name.description: Name of the egress Access Control List for the vlan-acl mapping

acl-name.description: Name of the webpolicy Access Control List(ACL) to be mapped to the REAP group

is-cwa.description: Enable or Disable central webauth for this ACL.

urlfilterlist-name.description: Mapping of IPv4/IPv6 ACL name to url filter list this ACL.

user-name.description: User name for this group, used for authenticating a client associated to an AP within the group

password.description:
Password for the given username, to be used for authenticating a client associated to an AP within the group. Following criteria should be met if wireless password policy is configured.
         - Default passwords (cisco, Cisco, C!sco, ci$co, ..) are not allowed.
         - Reverse default passwords are not allowed.
         - At least one lower case letter is mandatory.
         - At least one upper case letter is mandatory.
         - At least one digit is mandatory.
         - Special characters are allowed, but not mandatory.
         - More than two sequential chars or digits (e.g., abc, 123) are not allowed.
         - More than two repeated chars or digits (e.g., 111, aaa) are not allowed.
         - Minimum password length is 8.
         Restriction: Flex local auth password of cleartext type must contain ASCII characters only. This rule is not implemented using constraints.

password-type.description: Password encryption type for authentication by AP

interface-name.description: VLAN name for the vlan-acl mapping.

vlan-id.description: VLAN ID to be mapped to the ACL for the Access Point identified by VLAN name.

acl-name.description: Name of bidirectional Access Control List (ACL) for the VLAN-ACL mapping

acl-name-in.description: Name of ingress Access Control List (ACL) for the VLAN-ACL mapping

acl-name-out.description: Name of egress Access Control List(ACL) for the VLAN-ACL mapping

flex-overlap-ip-enable.description: Enable IP overlap support for site
